question: The "Petite Martinique Island" is under the administrative control of which country?
explanation: Petite Martinique is one of the islands of Carriacou and Petite Martinique, which is a dependency of Grenada. It is 2Â½ miles away from Carriacou. With its 586 acres and population of 900, it is smaller than Carriacou. Petite Martinique is much smaller, comprising about 9.8% of the total area and 30% of the entire population which is estimated at 10,000. The residents of this island live by boat-building, fishing and seafaring.
